p7:field.name: wired.transaction
p7:field.p7:documentation: A number acting as a transaction counter. This field is treated specially in that if it is set in a message, all messages that are a reply to that message should have this field set to the identical value. It is present, but optional in all messages that take part in transactions. It is recommended that this be incremented from its initial value for each new message sent, so that replies can be separated.

p7:field.name: wired.error
p7:field.p7:documentation: Enumeration of all the errors that can occur.

p7:field.name: wired.error.string
p7:field.p7:documentation: Additional error information as a string.

p7:field.name: wired.info.application.name
p7:field.p7:documentation: Application name, e.g. "Wired Client".

p7:field.name: wired.info.application.version
p7:field.p7:documentation: Application version, e.g. "1.0".

p7:field.name: wired.info.application.build
p7:field.p7:documentation: Application build, e.g. 1000.

p7:field.name: wired.info.os.name
p7:field.p7:documentation: Operating system name, e.g. "Mac OS X".

p7:field.name: wired.info.os.version
p7:field.p7:documentation: Operation system version, e.g. "10.5".

p7:field.name: wired.info.arch
p7:field.p7:documentation: System architecture name, e.g. "i386".

p7:field.name: wired.info.name
p7:field.p7:documentation: Server name from configuration.

p7:field.name: wired.info.description
p7:field.p7:documentation: Server description from configuration.

p7:field.name: wired.info.start_time
p7:field.p7:documentation: The time the server was started, i.e. its uptime.

p7:field.name: wired.info.files.count
p7:field.p7:documentation: The number of files the server is sharing.

p7:field.name: wired.info.files.size
p7:field.p7:documentation: The size of the files the server is sharing.

p7:field.name: wired.info.banner
p7:field.p7:documentation: Server banner as image data. The image format should be PNG, and the icon dimensions should not exceed 200x32 pixels.

p7:field.name: wired.info.downloads
p7:field.p7:documentation: The global limit on the number of download transfers, from configuration.

p7:field.name: wired.info.uploads
p7:field.p7:documentation: The global limit on the number of upload transfers, from configuration.

p7:field.name: wired.info.download_speed
p7:field.p7:documentation: The global limit on the download transfer speed in bytes/second, from configuration.

p7:field.name: wired.info.upload_speed
p7:field.p7:documentation: The global limit on the upload transfer speed in bytes/second, from configuration.

p7:field.name: wired.chat.id
p7:field.p7:documentation: Identification number of a chat. This number should be created when each chat is created, and be unique across all chats. The chat ID 1 identifies the public chat.

p7:field.name: wired.chat.topic.topic
p7:field.p7:documentation: Topic of the chat.

p7:field.name: wired.chat.topic.time
p7:field.p7:documentation: Time when the topic was set.

p7:field.name: wired.chat.say
p7:field.p7:documentation: A normal chat message, i.e. one formatted similar to "user: hello".

p7:field.name: wired.chat.me
p7:field.p7:documentation: An action chat message, i.e. one formatted similar to "user says hello".

p7:field.name: wired.user.id
p7:field.p7:documentation: Identification number of a user. Unique across all users.

p7:field.name: wired.user.idle
p7:field.p7:documentation: Should be set to true if the user has indicated it with the [message:wired.user.set_idle] message, or alternatively, if the user has been inactive for an application-defined length of time. Inactive in this context means that the user has not sent any message other than [message:wired.send_ping].

p7:field.name: wired.user.admin
p7:field.p7:documentation: Should be set to true if the user is logged in with an account that has the [field:wired.account.user.kick_users] or [field:wired.account.user.ban_users] privileges.

p7:field.name: wired.user.nick
p7:field.p7:documentation: Nick name of a user. This is not guaranteed to be unique across all users.

p7:field.name: wired.user.login
p7:field.p7:documentation: Login name of a user. This is the same as [field:wired.account.name] for user accounts, but used for logins.

p7:field.name: wired.user.password
p7:field.p7:documentation: Password of a user. This is the same as [field:wired.account.password], but used for logins. The string should be the hexadecimal representation of the SHA-1 hash of the actual password.

p7:field.name: wired.user.status
p7:field.p7:documentation: Status of a user.

p7:field.name: wired.user.icon
p7:field.p7:documentation: User icon as image data. The image format should be PNG, and the icon dimensions should not exceed 32x32 pixels.

p7:field.name: wired.user.ip
p7:field.p7:documentation: IP address of a user. Should be set to the string representation of either an IPv4 address, e.g. "127.0.0.1", or an IPv6 address, e.g. "::1".

p7:field.name: wired.user.host
p7:field.p7:documentation: Host name of the user. Should be resolved by the server, and set to the empty string if resolution fails.

p7:field.name: wired.user.cipher.name
p7:field.p7:documentation: Name of the cipher, e.g. "AES", used by the underlying protocol, if any.

p7:field.name: wired.user.cipher.bits
p7:field.p7:documentation: Number of bits, e.g. 256, used by the cipher for its key in the underlying protocol, if any.

p7:field.name: wired.user.login_time
p7:field.p7:documentation: Time of login of the user.

p7:field.name: wired.user.idle_time
p7:field.p7:documentation: Time of last activity of the user. See [field:wired.user.idle] for details on when this is reset.

p7:field.name: wired.user.disconnect_message
p7:field.p7:documentation: User-given message when that user forcibly parts another user.

p7:field.name: wired.user.disconnected_id
p7:field.p7:documentation: Same as [field:wired.user.id] but used when one user forcibly parts another user.

p7:field.name: wired.user.state
p7:field.p7:documentation: State of the user. [enum:wired.user.state.connected] means that the user has just logged in but not sent [message:wired.send_login] yet. [enum:wired.user.state.logging_in] means that the user has sent [message:wired.send_login] and is waiting for the server. [enum:wired.user.state.logged_in] means that the user is logged in. [enum:wired.user.state.transferring] means that the user is currently transferring a file. [enum:wired.user.sate.disconnecting] means that the user is disconnecting from the server.

p7:field.name: wired.message.message
p7:field.p7:documentation: A private message.

p7:field.name: wired.message.broadcast
p7:field.p7:documentation: A public broadcast message.

p7:field.name: wired.board.board
p7:field.p7:documentation: Path of a board. Board paths are similar to file system paths, and are separated by slashes, i.e. "/". Unlike a file system, however, there is no leading slash for root boards. As an example, a board at the root level may be called "Foo", and [field:wired.board.board] should then be "Foo" as well. A board that is a child of this board may be called "Bar", and [field:wired.board.board] should then be "Foo/Bar".

p7:field.name: wired.board.new_board
p7:field.p7:documentation: Same as [field:wired.board.board], but used when moving or renaming boards.

p7:field.name: wired.board.thread
p7:field.p7:documentation: Identifier of a thread on a board.

p7:field.name: wired.board.post
p7:field.p7:documentation: Identifier of a post in a thread.

p7:field.name: wired.board.post_date
p7:field.p7:documentation: Date when the post was created.

p7:field.name: wired.board.edit_date
p7:field.p7:documentation: Date when the post was last edited.

p7:field.name: wired.board.subject
p7:field.p7:documentation: Subject of a post.

p7:field.name: wired.board.text
p7:field.p7:documentation: Text of a post.

p7:field.name: wired.board.owner
p7:field.p7:documentation: Same as [field:wired.account.name] but used for board permissions.

p7:field.name: wired.board.owner.read
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the owner can read threads and posts on the board.

p7:field.name: wired.board.owner.write
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the owner can post threads and posts on the board.

p7:field.name: wired.board.group
p7:field.p7:documentation: Same as [field:wired.account.group] but used for board permissions.

p7:field.name: wired.board.group.read
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the members of the group can read threads and posts on the board.

p7:field.name: wired.board.group.write
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the members of the group can post threads and posts on the board.

p7:field.name: wired.board.everyone.read
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether everyone can read threads and posts on the board.

p7:field.name: wired.board.everyone.write
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether everyone can post threads and posts on the board.

p7:field.name: wired.board.own_post
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether this post was created by the currently logged in account.

p7:field.name: wired.file.path
p7:field.p7:documentation: Path to a file, separated by slashes, i.e. "/". The root directory is a single slash, i.e. "/".

p7:field.name: wired.file.type
p7:field.p7:documentation: File type. [enum:wired.file.type.file] indicates a normal file, and [enum:wired.file.type.directory] indicates a normal directory. The other two are specific to Wired, and are differentiated mostly by permissions. [enum:wired.file.type.uploads] are directories that may be uploaded into, and listed, while [enum:wired.file.type.dropbox] may be uploaded into, but not listed. Drop boxes can also have extended permissions, like [field:wired.file.owner], etc.

p7:field.name: wired.file.size
p7:field.p7:documentation: For files, this should be the size of the file in bytes. For directories, this should be the number of files contained in the directory.

p7:field.name: wired.file.creation_time
p7:field.p7:documentation: Date when the file was created.

p7:field.name: wired.file.modification_time
p7:field.p7:documentation: Date when the file was last modified.

p7:field.name: wired.file.comment
p7:field.p7:documentation: Comment of the file.

p7:field.name: wired.file.recursive
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether certain files requests should be recursive.

p7:field.name: wired.file.available
p7:field.p7:documentation: Number of bytes of free disk space.

p7:field.name: wired.file.new_path
p7:field.p7:documentation: Same as [field:wired.file.path], but used when renaming or moving files.

p7:field.name: wired.file.query
p7:field.p7:documentation: Query for file searches.

p7:field.name: wired.file.link
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether a file is a link (or alias, shortcut, etc). This may be true for any file type.

p7:field.name: wired.file.executable
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether a file is executable. This may only be true for files.

p7:field.name: wired.file.owner
p7:field.p7:documentation: Same as [field:wired.account.name] but used for file permissions.

p7:field.name: wired.file.owner.read
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the owner can list and read files in the directory.

p7:field.name: wired.file.owner.write
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the owner can upload and modify files in the directory.

p7:field.name: wired.file.group
p7:field.p7:documentation: Same as [field:wired.account.group] but used for file permissions.

p7:field.name: wired.file.group.read
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether members of the group can list and read files in the directory.

p7:field.name: wired.file.group.write
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether members of the group can upload and modify files in the directory.

p7:field.name: wired.file.everyone.read
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether everyone can list and read files in the directory.

p7:field.name: wired.file.everyone.write
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether everyone can upload and modify files in the directory.

p7:field.name: wired.file.label
p7:field.p7:documentation: Label of a file. This may be set for any file type.

p7:field.name: wired.file.volume
p7:field.p7:documentation: An application-defined identifier of the volume the file resides on. This may be set for any file type.

p7:field.name: wired.file.readable
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the currently logged in account can list and read files in the directory.

p7:field.name: wired.file.writable
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the currently logged in account can upload and modify files in the directory.

p7:field.name: wired.account.name
p7:field.p7:documentation: Name of an account.

p7:field.name: wired.account.new_name
p7:field.p7:documentation: Same as [field:wired.account.name] but used when renaming.

p7:field.name: wired.account.full_name
p7:field.p7:documentation: Full name of an account.

p7:field.name: wired.account.creation_time
p7:field.p7:documentation: Date when the account was created.

p7:field.name: wired.account.modification_time
p7:field.p7:documentation: Date when the account was last modified.

p7:field.name: wired.account.login_time
p7:field.p7:documentation: Date when the account was last logged in.

p7:field.name: wired.account.edited_by
p7:field.p7:documentation: Nick name of user who last edited the account. Like [field:wired.user.nick].

p7:field.name: wired.account.password
p7:field.p7:documentation: Password of an account. The string should be the hexadecimal representation of the SHA-1 hash of the actual password.

p7:field.name: wired.account.group
p7:field.p7:documentation: TBD

p7:field.name: wired.account.groups
p7:field.p7:documentation: TBD

p7:field.name: wired.account.files
p7:field.p7:documentation: Path within the files area that should be accessible to the account.

p7:field.name: wired.account.user.cannot_set_nick
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account cannot change its nick name.

p7:field.name: wired.account.user.get_info
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege to get info of other users.

p7:field.name: wired.account.user.kick_users
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege to kick other users.

p7:field.name: wired.account.user.ban_users
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege to ban other users.

p7:field.name: wired.account.user.cannot_be_disconnected
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account cannot be disconnected (i.e. kicked or banned).

p7:field.name: wired.account.user.get_users
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege to get a list of all users currently logged in.

p7:field.name: wired.account.chat.set_topic
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege to set the topic of the public chat.

p7:field.name: wired.account.chat.create_chats
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege to create new chats.

p7:field.name: wired.account.message.send_messages
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege to send private messages to other users.

p7:field.name: wired.account.message.broadcast
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege to broadcast messages to all users currently logged in.

p7:field.name: wired.account.board.read_boards
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege of reading boards.

p7:field.name: wired.account.board.add_boards
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege of creating boards.

p7:field.name: wired.account.board.move_boards
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege of moving boards.

p7:field.name: wired.account.board.rename_boards
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege of renaming boards.

p7:field.name: wired.account.board.delete_boards
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege of deleting boards.

p7:field.name: wired.account.board.set_permissions
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege of change board permissions.

p7:field.name: wired.account.board.add_threads
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege of creating new threads.

p7:field.name: wired.account.board.move_threads
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege of moving threads.

p7:field.name: wired.account.board.delete_threads
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege of deleting threads.

p7:field.name: wired.account.board.add_posts
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege of creating new posts.

p7:field.name: wired.account.board.edit_own_posts
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege of editing own posts.

p7:field.name: wired.account.board.edit_all_posts
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege of editing all posts.

p7:field.name: wired.account.board.delete_own_posts
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege of deleting own posts.

p7:field.name: wired.account.board.delete_all_posts
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege of deleting all posts.

p7:field.name: wired.account.file.list_files
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege of listing files.

p7:field.name: wired.account.file.get_info
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege of getting file info.

p7:field.name: wired.account.file.create_directories
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege of creating new directories.

p7:field.name: wired.account.file.create_links
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege of creating new file links.

p7:field.name: wired.account.file.move_files
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege of moving files.

p7:field.name: wired.account.file.rename_files
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege of renaming files.

p7:field.name: wired.account.file.set_type
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege of changing file types.

p7:field.name: wired.account.file.set_comment
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege of changing file comments.

p7:field.name: wired.account.file.set_permissions
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege of changing file permissions.

p7:field.name: wired.account.file.set_executable
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege of changing file executable flags.

p7:field.name: wired.account.file.set_label
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege of changing file labels.

p7:field.name: wired.account.file.delete_files
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege of deleting files.

p7:field.name: wired.account.file.access_all_dropboxes
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege of accessing all drop boxes.

p7:field.name: wired.account.file.recursive_list_depth_limit
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates the limit on the directory depth the account gives for recursive file operations. 0 means no limit.

p7:field.name: wired.account.transfer.download_files
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege of downloading files.

p7:field.name: wired.account.transfer.upload_files
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege of uploading new files in upload directories and drop boxes.

p7:field.name: wired.account.transfer.upload_directories
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege of uploading new directories in upload directories and drop boxes.

p7:field.name: wired.account.transfer.upload_anywhere
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege of uploading new files or directories in any directory.

p7:field.name: wired.account.transfer.download_limit
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates the limit on the number of simultaneous download transfers the account gives. 0 means no limit.

p7:field.name: wired.account.transfer.upload_limit
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates the limit on the number of simultaneous upload transfers the account gives. 0 means no limit.

p7:field.name: wired.account.transfer.download_speed_limit
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates the combined limit in speed in bytes/second for all download transfers the account gives. 0 means no limit.

p7:field.name: wired.account.transfer.upload_speed_limit
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates the combined limit in speed in bytes/second for all upload transfers the account gives. 0 means no limit.

p7:field.name: wired.account.account.change_password
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege of changing the password.

p7:field.name: wired.account.account.list_accounts
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege of listing other accounts.

p7:field.name: wired.account.account.read_accounts
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege of reading other accounts.

p7:field.name: wired.account.account.create_users
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege of creating new user accounts.

p7:field.name: wired.account.account.edit_users
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege of editing user accounts.

p7:field.name: wired.account.account.delete_users
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege of deleting user accounts.

p7:field.name: wired.account.account.create_groups
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege of creating new group accounts.

p7:field.name: wired.account.account.edit_groups
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege of editing group accounts.

p7:field.name: wired.account.account.delete_groups
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege of deleting group accounts.

p7:field.name: wired.account.account.raise_account_privileges
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege of creating or editing accounts to give them more privileges or higher limits than itself has.

p7:field.name: wired.account.log.view_log
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege of viewing the log.

p7:field.name: wired.account.settings.get_settings
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege of reading the server configuration.

p7:field.name: wired.account.settings.set_settings
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege of changing the server configuration.

p7:field.name: wired.account.banlist.get_bans
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege of reading the server banlist.

p7:field.name: wired.account.banlist.add_bans
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege of adding bans to the server banlist.

p7:field.name: wired.account.banlist.delete_bans
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege of removing bans from the server banlist.

p7:field.name: wired.account.tracker.list_servers
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege of listing other servers.

p7:field.name: wired.account.tracker.register_servers
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the account gives the privilege of registering other servers.

p7:field.name: wired.transfer.type
p7:field.p7:documentation: Type of a transfer. [enum:wired.transfer.type.download] is a download transfers, while [enum:wired.transfer.type.upload] is an upload transfer.

p7:field.name: wired.transfer.offset
p7:field.p7:documentation: Offset in bytes into a file from where the transfer should be resumed.

p7:field.name: wired.transfer.queue_position
p7:field.p7:documentation: Position in the server queue of a transfer.

p7:field.name: wired.transfer.data
p7:field.p7:documentation: Data of a transfer.

p7:field.name: wired.transfer.transferred
p7:field.p7:documentation: Number of bytes transferred so far for a transfer.

p7:field.name: wired.transfer.speed
p7:field.p7:documentation: Current speed in bytes/second for a transfer.

p7:field.name: wired.log.time
p7:field.p7:documentation: Date of a log entry.

p7:field.name: wired.log.level
p7:field.p7:documentation: Level of a log entry. [enum:wired.log.debug] is a debug log message, [enum:wired.log.info] is an informational log message, [enum:wired.log.warning] is a warning log message and [wired.log.error] is an error log message.

p7:field.name: wired.log.message
p7:field.p7:documentation: Message of a log entry.

p7:field.name: wired.settings.register_with_trackers
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the server should register with the trackers listed in [field:wired.setting.trackers].

p7:field.name: wired.settings.trackers
p7:field.p7:documentation: URLs of trackers the server should register with if [field:wired.settings.register_with_trackers] is on. The URL should be in the "wired://server[:port]/Category" format.

p7:field.name: wired.banlist.ip
p7:field.p7:documentation: An entry in the banlist. Should be set to the string representation of either an IPv4 address, e.g. "127.0.0.1", or an IPv6 address, e.g. "::1". It can also be a netblock, such as "127.0.0.1/8", or a wildcard string, such as "127.0.0.*".

p7:field.name: wired.banlist.expiration_date
p7:field.p7:documentation: Expiration date of an entry in the banlist.

p7:field.name: wired.tracker.tracker
p7:field.p7:documentation: Indicates whether the server also functions as a tracker.

p7:field.name: wired.tracker.categories
p7:field.p7:documentation: List of configured tracker categories.

p7:field.name: wired.tracker.category
p7:field.p7:documentation: A single tracker category, similar to [field:wired.tracker.categories] but used when registering.

p7:field.name: wired.tracker.ip
p7:field.p7:documentation: IP address of a server when registering with a tracker.

p7:field.name: wired.tracker.port
p7:field.p7:documentation: Port of a server when registering with a tracker.

p7:field.name: wired.tracker.token
p7:field.p7:documentation: Identification of a single server registered with a tracker.

p7:field.name: wired.tracker.url
p7:field.p7:documentation: URL of a server registered with a tracker. The URL should be in the "wired://server[:port]/Category" format.

p7:field.name: wired.tracker.users
p7:field.p7:documentation: Number of users currently logged in to a server registered with a tracker.

p7:message.name: wired.error
p7:message.p7:documentation: Error message. [field:wired.error] contains the error returned. [field:wired.error.string] is optional, but should contain an additional error string if [field:wired.error] is [enum:wired.error.internal_error].

p7:message.name: wired.banned
p7:message.p7:documentation: Login error due to ban. [field:wired.banlist.expiration_date] indicates the expiration date of the ban, if applicable.

p7:message.name: wired.chat.user_list
p7:message.p7:documentation: User list item message for a chat.

p7:message.name: wired.chat.user_list.done
p7:message.p7:documentation: User list completion message for a chat.

p7:message.name: wired.chat.user_join
p7:message.p7:documentation: User join message for a chat.

p7:message.name: wired.chat.user_leave
p7:message.p7:documentation: User leave message for a chat.

p7:message.name: wired.chat.set_topic
p7:message.p7:documentation: Change topic for a chat. [field:wired.chat.topic.topic] may be the empty string.

p7:message.name: wired.chat.topic
p7:message.p7:documentation: Topic message for a chat. [field:wired.chat.topic.topic] may be the empty string.

p7:message.name: wired.chat.send_say
p7:message.p7:documentation: Send a normal chat message for a chat. [field:wired.chat.say] may not be the empty string.

p7:message.name: wired.chat.say
p7:message.p7:documentation: Normal chat message for a chat. [field:wired.chat.say] may not be the empty string.

p7:message.name: wired.chat.send_me
p7:message.p7:documentation: Send an action chat message for a chat. [field:wired.chat.me] may not be the empty string.

p7:message.name: wired.chat.me
p7:message.p7:documentation: Action chat message for a chat. [field:wired.chat.me] may not be the empty string.

p7:message.name: wired.chat.invite_user
p7:message.p7:documentation: Invitation message for a user for a chat.

p7:message.name: wired.chat.invitation
p7:message.p7:documentation: Invivation message from a user for a chat.

p7:message.name: wired.user.set_nick
p7:message.p7:documentation: Change nick message. [field:wired.user.nick] may not be the empty string.

p7:message.name: wired.user.set_status
p7:message.p7:documentation: Change status message. [field:wired.user.status] may be the empty string.

p7:message.name: wired.user.set_icon
p7:message.p7:documentation: Change icon message. [field:wired.user.icon] may be empty.

p7:message.name: wired.user.get_info
p7:message.p7:documentation: Get info message for a user.

p7:message.name: wired.user.info
p7:message.p7:documentation: User info reply for a user. [field:wired.user.cipher.name] and [field:wired.user.cipher.bits] should be set only if the user has connected using encryption.

p7:message.name: wired.user.icon
p7:message.p7:documentation: User icon message. [field:wired.user.icon] may be empty.

p7:message.name: wired.user.status
p7:message.p7:documentation: User status message. Any of the fields, except [field:wired.user.id] may have changed, and it is not possible to find out which, except by caching the previous values. [field:wired.user.status] may be the empty string, but [field:wired.user.nick] may not.

p7:message.name: wired.chat.kick_user
p7:message.p7:documentation: Kick user message for a chat. Kicking the user from the public chat is not equal to disconnecting the user, and the user can rejoin the chat or send other messages. [field:wired.user.disconnect_message] may be the empty string.

p7:message.name: wired.chat.user_kick
p7:message.p7:documentation: User kicked message. [wired.user.id] is the user who performed the kick, and [field:wired.user.disconnected_id] is the user who was kicked. [field:wired.user.disconnect_message] may be the empty string.

p7:message.name: wired.user.ban_user
p7:message.p7:documentation: Ban user message. This is equivalent to adding the user to the banlist and then disconnecting the user. [field:wired.user.disconnect_message] may be the empty string.

p7:message.name: wired.user.user_ban
p7:message.p7:documentation: User banned message. [wired.user.id] is the user who performed the ban, and [field:wired.user.disconnected_id] is the user who was banned. [field:wired.user.disconnect_message] may be the empty string.

p7:message.name: wired.user.user_list
p7:message.p7:documentation: User list item message. If [field:wired.user.state] is [enum:wired.user.state.transferring], the fields [field:wired.transfer.type], [field:wired.file.path], [field:wired.file.size], [field:wired.transfer.transferred], [field:wired.transfer.speed] and [field:wired.transfer.queue_position] should be set. If [field:wired.transfer.queue_position] is set and not equal to 0, the transfer is currently in the queue at that position. Otherwise, the transfer is ongoing, and [field:wired.transfer.transferred] and [field:wired.transfer.speed] indicate its progression.

p7:message.name: wired.message.send_message
p7:message.p7:documentation: Send private message to a user. [field:wired.message.message] may not be the empty string.

p7:message.name: wired.message.message
p7:message.p7:documentation: Private message from a user. [field:wired.message.message] may not be the empty string.

p7:message.name: wired.message.send_broadcast
p7:message.p7:documentation: Send broadcast message to all users. [field:wired.message.message] may not be the empty string.

p7:message.name: wired.message.broadcast
p7:message.p7:documentation: Broadcast message to all users. [field:wired.message.message] may not be the empty string.

p7:transaction.p7:documentation:
Should be the first transaction. Until this has been completed, all other messages should reply with [message:wired.error] with [field:wired.error] set to [enum:wired.error.message_out_of_sequence].
After this has been completed, the client may send [message:wired.send_ping], [message:wired.send_login], [message:wired.user.set_nick], [message:wired.user.set_status] or [message:wired.user:set_icon].
May be initiated at any time, and must be responded to.

[message:wired.error] should be replied with [field:wired.error] set to [enum:wired.error.login_failed] if the user name or password is incorrect.
If the user is banned, [message:wired.banned] should be sent instead.
Otherwise, [message:wired.login] and [message:wired.account.privileges] should be replied in succession.
After this has completed, [message:wired.error] should no longer be sent be sent with [enum:wired.error.message_out_of_sequence].

Initial desired nick name should be sent before [message:wired.send_login] so that other clients see it.
Setting it while logged in to the public chat should cause a [broadcast:wired.user.status] to be broadcasted.
[message:wired.error] should be replied with [field:wired.error] set to [enum:wired.error.permission_denied], if [field:wired.account.user.cannot_set_nick] is set for the user's account.
[message:wired.error] should be replied with [field:wired.error] set to [enum:wired.error.message_out_of_sequence] if sent before [message:wired.client_info].
Otherwise, [message:wired.okay] should be replied.

Initial desired status should be sent before [message:wired.send_login] so that other clients see it.
Setting it while logged in to the public chat should cause a [broadcast:wired.user.status] to be broadcasted.
[message:wired.error] should be replied with [field:wired.error] set to [enum:wired.error.message_out_of_sequence] if sent before [message:wired.client_info].
Otherwise, [message:wired.okay] should be replied.

Initial desired icon should be sent before [message:wired.send_login] so that other clients see it.
Setting it while logged in to the public chat should cause a [broadcast:wired.user.status] to be broadcasted.
[message:wired.error] should be replied with [field:wired.error] set to [enum:wired.error.message_out_of_sequence] if sent before [message:wired.client_info].
Otherwise, [message:wired.okay] should be replied.

Setting it while logged in to the public chat should cause a [broadcast:wired.user.status] to be broadcasted.
[message:wired.error] should be replied with [field:wired.error] set to [enum:wired.error.message_out_of_sequence] if sent before [message:wired.client_info].
Otherwise, [message:wired.okay] should be replied.

[message:wired.error] should be replied with [enum:wired.error.permission_denied] if [field:wired.account.user.get_info] is not set for the user's account.
[message:wired.error] should be replied with [field:wired.error] set to [enum:wired.error.message_out_of_sequence] if sent before [message:wired.client_info].
Otherwise, [message:wired.user.info] should be replied.

[message:wired.error] should be replied with [enum:wired.error.permission_denied] if [field:wired.account.user.get_users] is not set for the user's account.
[message:wired.error] should be replied with [field:wired.error] set to [enum:wired.error.message_out_of_sequence] if sent before [message:wired.client_info].
Otherwise, one or more [message:wired.user.user_list] terminated by a single [message:wired.user.user_list.done] should be replied.

[message:wired.error] should be replied with [enum:wired.error.permission_denied] if [field:wired.account.message.broadcast] is not set for the user's account.
[message:wired.error] should be replied with [field:wired.error] set to [enum:wired.error.message_out_of_sequence] if sent before [message:wired.client_info].
Otherwise, [message:wired.okay] should be replied.
